app:section.title: General Section
app:section.para: On behalf of Acme, Inc. (the "Company"), I am pleased to offer you employment with the Company. In addition to confirming our offer, this letter will detail certain terms and conditions of your employment. Please confirm your acceptance of this offer by signing and returning it to me on or before .

app:section.title: Title
app:section.app:section-help: This section welcomes the new employee and informs them of their start date, position, and manager (if provided).
app:section.para: 1. Title. You will be employed, effective , in the US Full-time Exempt position of . You agree to devote your best efforts, skill, knowledge, attention and energies to the advancement of the Company's business and interests and to the performance of your duties and responsibilities as an employee of the Company.

app:section.name: base_comp
app:section.title: Base Compensation
app:section.app:section-help: Under Federal and state labor laws, there are certain jobs that are subject to overtime pay requirements and these are generally referred to as “non-exempt” positions. Employees in “exempt” positions are not covered by these requirements and therefore are not entitled to overtime under labor laws. Whether an employee is exempt or non-exempt generally depends on (a) how much they are paid, (b) how they are paid, and (c) what kind of work they do.

app:section.name: withholding_taxes
app:section.title: Withholding Taxes
app:section.para: 34. Withholding Taxes. All forms of compensation referred to in this letter are subject to all of the required and elected taxes and withholdings.

app:section.name: at_will
app:section.title: At Will Employment
app:section.para: 45. At Will Employment. Your employment with the Company is “at-will” and either you or the Company may terminate your employment at any time, with or without cause or advance notice. As a result, nothing in this letter is a promise or guarantee of employment for any specific period of time or continued employment. The Company also retains the right to make decisions concerning your employment (e.g., changes to your position, title, level, responsibilities, compensation, job duties, reporting structure, work location, work schedule, goals or any other managerial decisions) at any time, with or without cause or advance notice, as it deems appropriate in its sole discretion. Although your job duties, title, compensation and benefits, as well as the Company’s personnel policies and procedures, may change from time to time, the “at will” nature of your employment may only be changed by a written agreement signed by you and a duly authorized officer of the Company, which expressly states the intention to modify the at-will nature of your employment.

app:section.name: confidentiality_agreement
app:section.title: Confidentiality and Assignment Agreement
app:section.para:
56. Confidentiality and Assignment Agreement. The Company views the protection of its trade secrets and other confidential and proprietary information, such as customer or product information, as a matter of great importance and intends to train you and expose you to such information. Therefore, as a condition of this offer, your employment with the Company, the training the Company will provide you, the receipt of the compensation and benefits contained herein and the receipt of the Company's confidential and proprietary information during your employment, you are required to review and sign the Company's Confidentiality and Assignment Agreement. We urge you to review the Company's Confidentiality and Assignment Agreement closely because it contains obligations you will have as an employee relating to the Company's confidential and proprietary information and
a restriction limiting your ability to solicit or disrupt certain of the Company's existing relationships, during your employment and for a period of time after your employment with the Company ends. We understand that you may have obligations to your present and/or prior employers to safeguard the confidential and proprietary information of those organizations, and we expect and require that you will honor them. To that end, we expect that you will not take any documents or other confidential and/or proprietary information from your current employer when you depart. We also expect that you will not use any proprietary information, materials or documents of a former employer while performing your responsibilities for the Company.

app:section.name: work_authorization
app:section.title: Work Authorization
app:section.para: 67. Work Authorization. Under federal immigration laws, the Company is required to verify each new employee's identity and legal authority to work in the United States. Accordingly, please be prepared to furnish appropriate documents on your first day of employment satisfying those requirements (e.g., a valid U.S. passport). This offer of employment is conditional on submission of satisfactory documentation regarding your identity and authorization to work in the United States.

app:section.name: company_policies
app:section.title: Company Policies and Procedures
app:section.para: 78. Company Policies and Procedures. As an employee of the Company, you will be required to comply with (a) all Company policies and procedures and (b) all laws and regulations applicable to the Company’s business and performance of your duties for the Company. Violations of the Company's policies or applicable law may lead to immediate termination of your employment.

app:section.name: reference_check
app:section.title: Background/Reference Checks
app:section.para:
89. Background/Reference Checks.
You may need to complete an employment application or allow the Company to complete a background and/or reference check to its satisfaction as a condition of your employment. You agree to execute the forms necessary for the processing of any such background and/or reference checks.

app:section.name: electronic_delivery
app:section.title: Electronic Delivery
app:section.para: 910. Electronic Delivery. The Company may, in its sole discretion, decide to deliver to you by email or any other electronic means any documents or notices related to this letter, your employment with the Company, securities of the Company or any of its affiliates or any other matter, including documents and/or notices required to be delivered to you by applicable laws. You consent to receive such documents or notices by electronic means and also agree to participate through any on-line or electronic system that may be established and maintained by the Company or a third party designated by the Company.

app:section.name: integration
app:section.title: Integration
app:section.para: 101. Integration. This offer letter and the agreements, policies, rules and procedures referenced herein are our complete understanding regarding your employment with the Company. Accordingly, it supersedes and completely replaces any prior oral or written communications on the subject.
